li.a: Texas Dept of Health Immunizations Branch
Guidelines For Sending ILL Students Home
Guidelines For Sending ILL Students Home (Spanish)

div.p: As news continues to evolve concerning novel Coronavirus (COVID-19), the Abilene ISD is continuing to monitor the situation through proven and reliable sources. Because this situation is ever-changing, please bookmark this page and refer to it in regards to how the AISD is dealing with the Coronavirus.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_3 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light

ol.li: Hugh Sandifer Stadium West parking lot (Wylie ISD football stadium)
Parking lot off Kirkwood St. between N. 2nd and N. 3rd
Parking lot of old Wal-Mart on North Judge Ely
Parking lot of SW Park Baptist church on South 20th
Parking lot of North Park Baptist Church at Anson Ave. & Beech

div.p: AISD internet can be accessed by going to any district campus and using AISD Visitor WiFi
Hugh Sandifer Stadium West parking lot (Wylie ISD football stadium)
Continental Villa Apartments (trailer park) off Arnold Blvd.

p.span: Parking lot off Kirkwood St. between North 2nd and North 3rd
Parking lot of old Wal-Mart on North Judge Ely Blvd.
Parking lot of Southwest Park Baptist Church on South 20th and Matador
Parking lot of North Park Baptist Church at Anson Ave. and Beech

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_4 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light

div.p: Free breakfast and lunch to all children 18 and under. Meals can be picked up in drive-thru fashion at Bowie, Bonham, Dyess, Johnston, Lee, Martinez, Ortiz, Reagan and Ward elementary schools, and Clack, Craig, Madison and Mann middle schools.
div.h6: Each vehicle will be allowed to pick up meals for up to six children (ages 1-18), whether they are In the vehicle or not at the time of pick up.

div.class: et_pb_with_border et_pb_module et_pb_text et_pb_text_5 et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light

li.a: Donate to United Way of Abilene Coronavirus Relief Fund
Donate to Community Foundation of Abilene Coronavirus Relief Fund
CDC (U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
CDC Official Map of Confirmed U.S. Cases
CDC Keeping Work, School & Home Safe

li.span: Wash hands regularly with soap and water for at least 20 seconds;
Use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer if soap is not available;
Cover your mouth and nose with a tissue when you cough or sneeze, then throw the tissue in the trash;
Avoid touching your eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands;
Avoid close contact with people who are sick;
Stay home while you have a fever or experience illness;
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

div.p:
241 Pine Street | Abilene, TX 79601
Phone: 325-677-1444
AskAbileneISD | Site Map

hr.div: Abilene Independent School District adopted a tax rate that will raise more taxes for maintenance and operations than last year's tax rate.
